page.title: 01View from Castle Frome
page.content: A quiet corner of old county of Herefordshire. From top of escarpent above Castle Frome the view west is over a rolling landscape of valleys nd wooded hills to highest point in county on Black mountains. Below is small valley of river Frome which flows past the parkland of Canon Frome and on to join the Lugg. To north the A4103 carries the traffic between the twin county towns of Hereford and Worcester. This is a thinly populated landscape with grass for fattening cattle,cider apple orchards and hops. The pattern of this landscape has probably changed little in past 700 years.
